TopicTitle: The 0.25 Waiting Room, now boarding passengers heading to Hypetown

Articles.Content:

And yeah, I couldn't sleep so I'm back at the controls.
So far, HypeTrains are the largest minority! Splitting up Shuttles and Planes was a great idea! [/evil]

So far, HypeTrains are the largest minority! Splitting up Shuttles and Planes was a great idea! [/evil]

maybe so, but i now have to sleep away the night, tomorrow about this time I shall unleash he full power of the HypePlane

Can't wait for 0.25! [hype intensifies]

HypeTrain continuing along at Mach 70. There's a chain of tunnels ahead, so caution to those in sleepers with the lights out. (Based on a true story of mine lol. I was taking the train from Oxnard to Oakland and there were a set of tunnels. In the sleeper cars, the lights are controlled by you, so upon entering the tunnel, it was pitch black.)

Time to power up the hype-rdrive

Javascript is disabled. View full album

here's my HypeTrain07 replica in KSP. It's a magnificent sight! It even has a separate tender! Based on the proper LMS Stanier Black Five engine!

EDIT:

Here's the DL link

https://www.dropbox.com/s/5rpvbe7hl7rxg8r/SPH.zip?dl=0

Just put the two .craft files into the SPH folder of your ships folder. You must dock the two crafts together separately by taking the Engine, moving it CAREFULLY off the runway, then loading the tender, then backing the engine up to the tender. The Engine seems to help with the not tipping on the sides of the runway, but you must go very slanted or the front and even the back will explode! This replica is very fragile!

Edited September 18, 2014 by Wanderfound

I just wanted to say this is bs. I disappear for a couple months, come back, finally start a career in .24 that I actually play, just got a bunch of great mods, haven't even gotten past Minmus yet, and the new version is coming out. Raaaaaage.

Actually I'm mostly kidding, I think it's pretty awesome that these features are coming so soon. I just don't want to do the obligatory fresh career save again and wait for my favorite mods to be updated.

I just wanted to say this is bs. I disappear for a couple months, come back, finally start a career in .24 that I actually play, just got a bunch of great mods, haven't even gotten past Minmus yet, and the new version is coming out. Raaaaaage.

Actually I'm mostly kidding, I think it's pretty awesome that these features are coming so soon. I just don't want to do the obligatory fresh career save again and wait for my favorite mods to be updated.

Continue to play 0.24 then, which is what I will probably do. Scott Manley waited a while to update from 0.23.5 to 0.24 for interstellar quest.

Continue to play 0.24 then, which is what I will probably do. Scott Manley waited a while to update from 0.23.5 to 0.24 for interstellar quest.

Yes, I'll tell myself I'll do that but I won't. I still have a lot of unfinished business in .23.5 to be honest. That was where I made my best progress (I've only been here since... .22?). There's something good to be said about starting over from scratch especially with new parts and features, I just absolutely hate making that first mouse click to do it instead of trying to drag my old save into the new version.
Planes? Not cool enough!
